bill_title: limit compensatory damages in civil actions related to death or injury.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit compensatory damages in civil actions related to death or injury. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 21-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: In an action to recover damages resulting from death or injury, the damages that may be recovered by a claimant for reasonable and necessary health care services or treatment received shall include only: (1) Amounts actually paid by or on behalf of the claimant; and (2) Amounts actually necessary to satisfy unpaid charges still due and payable to the health care service provider for which the claimant or a third party on behalf of the claimant has a legal obligation to pay. Section 2. That chapter 21-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Unpaid charges under section 1 of this Act shall not exceed amounts customarily accepted by health care service providers for the health care services or treatment at issue in satisfaction of their bills. Section 3. That chapter 21-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The gross amounts of a claimant's medical bills are inadmissible as evidence of damages where such gross amounts are not reflective of the actual amounts paid or that remain actually owed to satisfy those bills. Section 4. That chapter 21-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: This Act is in addition to, and does not otherwise affect, any other limitation on damages.
